sn22.22:4.3: “Mendicants, I will teach you the burden, the bearer of the burden, the picking up of the burden, and the putting down of the burden.
sn22.22:4.6: The five grasping aggregates, it should be said.
sn22.22:4.8: The grasping aggregates of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
sn22.22:5.1: And who is the bearer of the burden?
sn22.22:5.2: The person, it should be said;
sn22.22:5.3: the venerable of such and such name and clan.
sn22.22:5.4: This is called the bearer of the burden.
sn22.22:6.1: And what is the picking up of the burden?
sn22.22:6.2: It’s the craving that leads to future rebirth, mixed up with relishing and greed, looking for enjoyment in various different realms. That is,
sn22.22:6.3: craving for sensual pleasures, craving for continued existence, and craving to exterminate existence.
sn22.22:6.4: This is called the picking up of the burden.
sn22.22:7.1: And what is the putting down of the burden?
sn22.22:7.2: It’s the fading away and cessation of that very same craving with nothing left over; giving it away, letting it go, releasing it, and not clinging to it.
sn22.22:7.3: This is called the putting down of the burden.”
sn22.22:8.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn22.22:8.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn22.22:9.2: and the person is the bearer of the burden.
sn22.22:9.3: Picking up the burden is suffering in the world,
sn22.22:9.4: and putting the burden down is happiness.
sn22.22:10.1: When the heavy burden is put down
sn22.22:10.3: and craving’s pulled out from the root,
